description: This Dart source file defines the ApiClient class, which is a wrapper around the http package's Client to facilitate network requests within a Flutter application. It handles constructing URIs, setting headers, logging network activity, and provides methods for GET and POST requests with JSON decoding. It utilizes environment configuration and preferences for tokens and base URL management.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A class that provides methods to perform HTTP GET and POST requests with automatic header management, URI construction, and optional logging.

methods.name: ApiClient
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the HTTP client and sets the base URL from environment config.

methods.name: _defaultHeaders
methods.description: Creates default request headers, including authorization if a token is provided.

methods.name: _buildUri
methods.description: Constructs a full Uri from a path and optional query parameters.

methods.name: _wrap
methods.description: Handles the execution of HTTP methods including logging request and response details.

methods.description: Performs a POST request with JSON payload, returning the decoded JSON response.
